I've spent my career managing the company's money, and now I'm stealing it hand over fist. Every spreadsheet, every financial report is now part of an elaborate fiction I've created. I've built a complex web of fake vendors, inflated expenses, and offshore accounts, siphoning off millions. The thrill of watching my personal accounts grow, of outsmarting auditors and executives, is intoxicating. But the fear of discovery is crushing. One misplaced decimal, one overly curious intern, and my whole world implodes. I tell myself I deserve this after years of being undervalued, that the company won't even notice the loss. But I know it's not true. I'm betraying the trust of everyone I work with, risking the livelihood of my colleagues. How did I go from being a guardian of the company's finances to its greatest threat?
